meanings.definition: To cover with a thin layer of gold.
meanings.sent1: She decided to engild the picture frame to make it look more elegant.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a special brush to engild the edges of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to engild his friend's shoes as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to engild the entire sky with its warm hues.
meanings.sent5: The morning dew appeared to engild the grass, creating a magical scene.

meanings.definition: To give a golden color or luster to something.
meanings.sent1: The sunlight seemed to engild the leaves of the trees in the park.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler used a special technique to engild the necklace with a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient could engild any dish with a touch of luxury.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had the power to engild even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The golden retriever's fur appeared to engild in the warm afternoon sunlight.
